overview_of_class: This course will encourage you to think critically about the role of sound in narrative film and re-introduce you to cinema from a sound-first perspective. Through case studies of sound across film genres and practical applications of sound design techniques you will gain confidence in your ability to communicate and create sonically. You will create soundscapes in the style of specific genres, present on the work of chosen sound designers, and get an introduction to various post-production and recording techniques.

overview_of_class: From long-form documentaries like S-Town to interview shows like Another Round, podcasts have quickly become an essential part of our culture. This course will immerse students in the contemporary podcast landscape, while examining its antecedents including the radio feature, public radio journalism, oral history, and 'zine culture. We will also explore modes of listening and critique. While this is not primarily a production course, students will use the medium of audio storytelling to respond to assignments, completing several short audio exercises and, if they choose, a larger podcast project. Students will leave the course with the ability think like both a podcast producer and critic, with an understanding of the medium's past and possibilities for its future.

descriptions.value: From long-form documentaries like S-Town to interview shows like Another Round, podcasts have quickly become an essential part of our culture. This course will immerse students in the contemporary podcast landscape, while examining its antecedents including the radio feature, public radio journalism, oral history, and 'zine culture. We will also explore modes of listening and critique. While this is not primarily a production course, students will use the medium of audio storytelling to respond to assignments, completing several short audio exercises and, if they choose, a larger podcast project. Students will leave the course with the ability think like both a podcast producer and critic, with an understanding of the medium's past and possibilities for its future.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will become familiar with the fast-growing world of narrative audio storytelling and its opportunities; practice new modes of critical listening and analysis; and develop basic podcast production skills including story choice, interviewing, narrative structure and sound design.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Class participation, weekly audio responses, written podcast review, and final project (choice of critical essay or production of podcast "pilot").
